title.narrative: MODELS FOR DECENTRALISED Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) DELIVERY

description.narrative: Target LGUs and School Divisions increasingly implement evidence-based approaches for improved Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) in communities, schools and ECCD centres., which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of the country program, increased access to high-impact preventive services for pregnant women, newborns and children and household behavior change interventions (focused on skilled birth attendance & newborn/ child care, nutrition, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and HIV) for resource-challenged vulnerable LGUs with high incidence of child mortality (selected regions with <50 per cent SBA coverage and >31 per cent underweight) and HIV (selected high incidence LGUS with high-risk youth groups), Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) (selected LGUs with <45 per cent sanitation coverage) through strengthen local decentralized health systems and at the same time building resilience as well as advocating for upstream policy changes.

participating-org.narrative: AGENCY FOR TECHNICAL COOPERATION AND DEVELOPMENT ACTED

mailing-address.narrative: 31st Floor Yuchengco Tower Rizal Commercial Banking Corporation (RCBC) Plaza 6819 Ayala Avenue corner Gil Puyat Avenue Makati City

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
Sanitation - improving services in rural communities (except household water treatment and storage, moving up the ladder and strengthening sustainability)
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Water supply - safety/quality/treatment (including household treatment and safe storage)

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Target LGUs and School Divisions increasingly implement evidence-based approaches for improved WASH in communities, schools andECCD centres.

description.narrative: UNICEF continued to model the Phased Approach to Sustainable Sanitation X including as part of an integrated First 1,000 Days programme X in priority municipalities, and to advocate and build capacities for province-led replication. Piloting of tools to support handwashing promotion and menstrual hygiene management progressed under the WinS program | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/01/2019
